alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 04 at 2:33PM CST until March 05 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Possible Late Saturday Morning through Saturday Afternoon... .Strong winds associated with a low pressure system combined with dry air could promote critical fire weather conditions across parts of north central Kansas late Saturday morning through Saturday afternoon. Winds will start Saturday morning from the southwest, becoming westerly early in the afternoon and finally northwesterly by mid to late afternoon. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 006, 007, 018 AND 019... The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Saturday morning through Saturday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 006 Smith, Fire Weather Zone 007 Jewell, Fire Weather Zone 018 Osborne and Fire Weather Zone 019 Mitchell. * WINDS...Before noon: Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. Afternoon: West becoming Northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * TIMING...Late Saturday morning through Saturday afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 18 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite may spread rapidly and exhibit extreme fire behavior. Use extreme caution if engaging in activities that could lead to fire ignition.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
